entry.title: The Profile Icon in the NTP page is breaked and not looking Clearly
entry.content:
Chrome Version :123.0.6302.0 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: M121 Rollout) Revision :f7b500ca3431d37194eccdec5138601a342f0489-refs/branch-heads/6302@{#1}
OS: Win(10,11)
Pre Conditions: Login Successfully
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch Chrome and Login Successfully. 2. Open NTP and Observe the Profile Icon. 3. The Profile Icon in NTP page is breaked and not looking Clearly.
Actual Result : The Profile Icon in the NTP page is breaked and not looking Clearly.
Expected Result : The Profile Icon in NTP page should not break and it should look Clearly.
This Issue is exists from M-113 onwards. So Raising it as a NR Issue.
Hence this is Non-Regression Issue, Making the Status to Untriaged so that the issue would get addressed.
Please find the attached screencast below..! https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ClK3I0STTByxUJEIX5GggBklu7rB4eOs/view?usp=sharing https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bx8atBAIiwYg3GKJEcIW4P6CZtCe9kR_/view?usp=sharing
Note: 1. This issue is able to repro on Stable #122.0.6261.39, Beta #122.0.6261.39 and Dev #123.0.6286.0
Thank You...!!

entry.title: TD with vertical align middle is rendered as top align when the cell splits over a page
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Create table with 3x1 with td with vertical-align: middle 2. Open print preview 3. Choose page size so 3rd row of table is split. Example HTML:
header
row 1
row 2
row 3
# Problem Description Vertical align should be preserved. It used to work in Chrome 84. # Additional Comments See row 3 with wrong align. # Summary TD with vertical align middle is rendered as top align when the cell splits over a page # Custom Questions #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below #### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself #### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem # Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Add old_group/new_group fields to WebStateListStatus
Add Tab Groups support to the new serialization code
[Chrome iOS] Gamepad API does not work
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Connect a gamepad to an iOS device (in my case I used bluetooth to pair the controller to the device) 2. In the Safari browser on iOS, visit https://hardwaretester.com/gamepad. Press some buttons on the gamepad. 2. In Chrome on iOS, visit https://hardwaretester.com/gamepad. Press some buttons on the gamepad.
# Problem Description Observed result:
In the Safari browser, it successfully detects the gamepad and its input. In Chrome on iOS no gamepad input is ever detected.
Expected result:
Chrome on iOS to also be able to detect gamepad input.
# Additional Comments I originally discovered this issue and assumed it was a WKWebView bug and filed it with Apple here: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=269292
Apple's response was: "To expose Gamepad support, your WKWebView needs to be the firstResponder."
So it may be the case that Chrome for iOS needs to configure its WKWebView to allow gamepad input to work.
# Summary [Chrome iOS] Gamepad API does not work
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>GamepadAPI
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Add Tab Groups support to the previous serialization code
Adapt DeserializeWebStateListInternal to deserialize groups
Adapt SerializeWebStateList to serialize groups
Add TabGroupStorage to WebStateListStorage

Adapt DetachWebStateAt to update group tags and group ranges
Adapt MoveWebStateAt to update group tags and group ranges
Adapt InsertWebStateAt to update group tags and group ranges
Add an internal method to clear empty groups (to be called at the end of all other group-modifying methods)
Add DeleteGroup
Add MoveGroup
Add RemoveFromGroups
Add MoveToGroup
Add CreateGroup
GANGGU

entry.title: OOPIF PDF: Embedded PDF does not load with data URL
entry.content:
Repro Steps:
1. Open Chrome with flag PdfOopif
2. Navigate to embedded PDF with data URL **Ex:** *data:text/html,<html><head><title>TabTitleWithEmbeddedPdf</title></head><body><embed type=application/pdf src=http://dhveerap-3660/test.pdf></body></html>*
3. PDF is not loaded.
4. Devtools has below error
>pdf_viewer_wrapper.js:583 Uncaught DOMException: Failed to read the 'localStorage' property from 'Window': Access is denied for this document.\ at LocalStorageProxyImpl.getItem (chrome-extension://mhjfbmdgcfjbbpaeojofohoefgiehjai/pdf_viewer_wrapper.js:583:56)\ at new PdfViewerElement (chrome-extension://mhjfbmdgcfjbbpaeojofohoefgiehjai/pdf_viewer_wrapper.js:619:2300)\ at chrome-extension://mhjfbmdgcfjbbpaeojofohoefgiehjai/pdf_viewer_wrapper.js:619:14456
> pdf_viewer_wrapper.js:619 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'scroller')\ at PdfViewerElement.init (pdf_viewer_wrapper.js:619:2522)\ at initViewer (main.js:24:12)
PFA for the screenshot for more details.

entry.title: Windows standalone closes tree from time to time.
entry.content:
Sometimes the windows standalone builder fails in CI and closes the tree: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/devtools-frontend/builders/ci/Stand-alone%20Win/11433/overview .
Unit tests seem to not be able to start Chrome and crushes without creating the karma-coverage folder. Then on the bot the recipe crushes in processing the non-existent coverage files.

entry.title: Extend MiraclePtr coverage to more containers
entry.content: Use the clang rewriter under tools/clang/rewrite_templated_container_fields/ to rewrite more containers.

entry.title: Formatter does not recognize #unavailable in Swift
entry.content:
The following code is not recognized by the formatter.
``` if #available(iOS 17.0) { ..} ```
When running `git cl format` it returns:
``` error: file contains invalid or unrecognized Swift syntax. ```

entry.title: Fallback tab dragging: Chromium crashes or tab appears in new window on click after dragging tab into other window
entry.content:
Pasting the relevant part of https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40944743#comment11:
If you drag a tab into a target window outside of the tab bar, the tab disappears. The next time you click on any chrome window, there's a 50/50 chance of chrome crashing or the tab reappearing in a new window. When chrome crashes, it prints the following to stdout:
``` [0214/135054.417901:ERROR:elf_dynamic_array_reader.h(64)] tag not found [0214/135054.418409:ERROR:elf_dynamic_array_reader.h(64)] tag not found [0214/135054.418559:ERROR:elf_dynamic_array_reader.h(64)] tag not found Trace/breakpoint trap ```

entry.title: Tests are failing: inspector_backend.py(830): telemetry.core.exceptions.DevtoolsTargetCrashException: Devtools target crashed\n***************************************...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): inspector_backend.py(830): telemetry.core.exceptions.DevtoolsTargetCrashException: Devtools target crashed
********************************************************************************
(/b/swarming/w/ir/third_party/catapult/telemetry/telemetry/internal/backends/chrome_inspector/inspector_backend.py:896 _AddDebuggingInformation) Received a socket error in the browser connection and the tab still exists. The operation probably timed out.
********************************************************************************
(/b/swarming/w/ir/third_party/catapult/telemetry/telemetry/internal/backends/chrome_inspector/inspector_backend.py:897 _AddDebuggingInformation) Debugger url: ws://127.0.0.1:44719/devtools/page/0
Found Minidump: False
Stack Trace:
********************************************************************************
Unable to get stack trace.
********************************************************************************
Standard output:
************************************************************...
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_gpu_integration_test_android_chrome/gpu_tests.webgl1_conformance_integration_test.WebGL1ConformanceIntegrationTest.conformance/ogles/GL/build/build_049_to_056.html - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_gpu_integration_test_android_chrome/gpu_tests.webgl1_conformance_integration_test.WebGL1ConformanceIntegrationTest.conformance/ogles/GL/build/build_089_to_096.html - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_gpu_integration_test_android_chrome/gpu_tests.webgl1_conformance_integration_test.WebGL1ConformanceIntegrationTest.conformance/ogles/GL/matrixCompMult/matrixCompMult_001_to_004.html - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_gpu_integration_test_android_chrome/gpu_tests.webgl1_conformance_integration_test.WebGL1ConformanceIntegrationTest.conformance/ogles/GL/mat3/mat3_001_to_006.html - ninja://chrome/test:telemetry_gpu_integration_test_android_chrome/gpu_tests.webgl1_conformance_integration_test.WebGL1ConformanceIntegrationTest.conformance/ogles/GL/inversesqrt/inversesqrt_001_to_006.html
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/fab9c75d52fac91e0a6b53d30c9d4170
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Feature Request: Clear Browsing Data: Cleanup data related to a specific website(i.e. github.com/*)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Not a bug, it's a new feature request.
# Problem Description Currently Google Chrome offers feature where a user can clean the browsing data based on time frame like last one hour, one day, all time, etc. But their is not such option by which a user can delete the browsing data related to a particular website. This could be very handy in maintaining the history related to important websites and also in improved search history.
# Additional Comments I am not aware of the Chrome code but ready to help whatever I can in making this feature available.
# Summary Feature Request: Clear Browsing Data: Cleanup data related to a specific website(i.e. github.com/*)
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Feature - Request for new or improved features
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: url_parse utils should use string_view instead of const char*
entry.content:
The functions in `url/third_party/mozilla/url_parse.h` currently receive `const char*` as input - in some cases accompanied by a length parameter.
It'd be nice to modernize them to take `std::string_view`.

entry.title: Change the initiator arrow design
[Android System Health Rotation Memory]: 2 regressions in system_health.memory_mobile
entry.content:

entry.title: [Accessibility & Talk Back ON] Chrome Settings: Unable to navigate to the link
entry.content:
**Device Info**: Android 14, Pixel 5 Build/UP1A.231105.003.A2
**Chrome Canary**: 123.0.6301.0
**Pre condition**: - Accessibility -> Turn On Talk back
**Steps to repro**:
- Launch Chrome and complete FRE. - Navigate to setting -> Privacy & security -> scroll towards down - For more setting that relate to privacy, security, and data collection, see **Sync** & **Google Services** -> Tap on Google services - Observe the behaviour
**Expected Behaviour**:
- It should be tapped & navigated to Google services page | [Screenshot](https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AptadsrrLiqYAEu.png)
**Actual Behavior**:
- Unable to tap & navigating to Google services - [Video](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11Y69eSQCQn3GMzYRkJ3CKYd1AkdN905K/view?usp=sharing)
**Note**: - There are 2 links, but one link is tapped & navigating to the page [Eg:For Sync option -> Able to navigate to sync page]
- This is a non - regression issue
**Additional Observations**: * Checked the issue on Android 14; **Pixel 8 Build/UQ1A.240205.004** | Chrome Canary 123.0.6301.0 - **Not able to tap & navigate on both **Sync** & **Google Services** options** - [Video](https://drive.google.com/file/d/10sHQYr1EMPkK5FiXhg7F4pSWBnCV8a0u/view?usp=sharing)
**Logs**: Please find the attached logs
